content: readme.md tmux-session-spectrum is script makes tmux different panel colors different sessions. it action:each session uses color the bottom panel, that different sessions aremore easily distinguishable between each .also automatically renumerates default session names, analogous renumber-windows windows.installation script requires tmux version be less 2.3. install copy tmux-session-spectru.sh file ~/.tmux directory add your ~/.tmux.conf following command:set-hook -g -new-session "run-shell 'bash ~/.tmux/tmux-session-spectrum.sh'" you to change default style, pass as environment variable:set-hook -g -new-session "run-shell 'default_style=colour4 bash ~/.tmux/tmux-session-spectrum.sh'" you your ~/.tmux.conf with both older tmux versions don't support script the newer ones, can done using tmux conditional directive:-shell "bash -c \"[[ ! $(tmux -v | cut -d' ' -f2) < 2.3 ]]\"" "\ set-hook -g -new-session \"run-shell 'bash ~/.tmux-session.sh\'\""
